page.title: 10FARMING
page.content: Over the last 20 years Agriculture in the area has changed considerably with the old small,hedged fields giving way to large rectangular ones from which hedges have been removed in order to accommodate modern machinery. The steepest part of the scarp is forested, chiefly by conifers but with pockets of native deciduous trees being planted as conifers are felled. The dip slope of Wenlock Edge & the less steep part of the scarp is given to cereal farming, particularly barley which has replaced the former activity of sheep rearing.This has been facilitated by the advent of high-powered,4 wheel drive tractors. On the lower,wetter land dairying predominates.This is a highly scientific process,with cattle fed by computer programmes according to yield & milked in modern milking parlours.
